title: Do you usually drive with or without music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not usually, always. The radio is always on, so music begins as soon as the car starts. And I have a large CD collection so there are always a few of those in the car too. My favorite job was being a courier. Customers paid me to enjoy music. Drive 2–3,000 miles a week listening to tunes the whole time. There was no such thing as satellite radio back then, so you had to change the dial often. Or bring a lot of cassette tapes.

Usually I listen to XM Radio Classic Rock when driving, but lately I have been listening to a variety of podcasts. What I also most never listen to is AM/FM Radio because I want to minimize commercials and DJ yak yak.

Music can turn your mind away from drive in harsh traffic or hilly roads. This has caused many accidents. Hence mostly I like to drive without music. Music is OK, if you are in a group drive and road is not risky.
